result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Maurice M Johnson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Maurice M Johnson in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve EIGHTEEN (18) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for EIGHTEEN (18) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Restitution payable to UW CREDIT UNION for ONE THOUSAND SEVENTEEN DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-SEVEN CENTS ($1,017.87) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT FORTHWITH SUBJECT TO TAX INTERCEPT 
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 03-15-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction for a period of six months.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Maurice M Johnson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 1/14/15 @ 9:30am
